Click the link below to view the City Council Meeting:

City Council Meeting

View City Council Meeting here

The council meets on the third Wednesday of each month at 6:00 p.m. at City Hall, 101 East Main Ave, Robstown, TX 78380 and can be viewed live by clicking the link above. Special City Council Meetings and Workshops may be scheduled at different times; notice will be posted on this website.

Effective February 21, 2024 regular City Council meetings will be held at 6:00pm on the third Wednesday of the month.

Agendas Archive:

view agenda view video

City Council Meetings

The City Council welcomes your attendance and participation at its meetings. The council meets on the third Wednesday of each month at 6:00 p.m. at City Hall, 101 East Main Ave, Robstown, TX 78380. Comments from the public are welcome during the  “Public Comments” portion of the agenda. (Refer to Rules of Decorum listed below as adopted by City Council February 11, 2002).

: In order to conduct City business in an orderly fashion, and to properly discharge its duty, the City Council must hear in many instances a variety of differing viewpoints.  To obtain all relevant information from differing viewpoints, rules of decorum are necessary.  Thus, the City Council adopted the following rules to assist in the orderly deliberation of matter affecting the City and its citizens.

  • No Council Member, staff person, or member of the audience shall berate, embarrass, accuse, or show any personal disrespect for any member of the staff, Council Members, or the public at any Council meeting.
  • While the City Council is in session there shall be no smoking of cigarettes, pipes or cigars; no consumption of any kind by the audience; no propping of feet on tables or chairs; no loud noises, talking, shouting, etc.; no loud demonstrating for or against the Council or any speaker, issue, or presentation; no applause, booing, hissing, foot stomping, parading, singing, or other disruptive inappropriate behavior.
  • Demonstrations shall not be permitted while the City Council is in session, including marches, chanting, picketing, any other coercive, argumentative, political, and/or disruptive behavior of any kind.
  • In addressing the City Council, members of the audience shall rise, go to the podium, and remain standing while addressing the Council. They shall remain at the podium and speak into the microphone for the recording of the proceedings and begin by giving their full name and address.  Citizens shall not approach the City Council table except with permission or request of the Mayor or City Council.

In compliance with the , individuals who will require accommodations at the meeting are asked to advise the Administrative Assistant no later than 48 hours prior to the meeting so that arrangements can be made (387-4589).
